titles.title: A bill to authorize the President to impose a tariff surcharge on the products of certain countries in order to offset the expense of providing United States defense assistance to such countries.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 2/11/1987--Introduced. Authorizes the President to impose tariff surcharges on articles imported from Japan, France, or any country within the North Atlantic Treaty Organization if the President determines that the cost of providing such country with defense assistance should be offset by tariff surcharges. Earmarks revenues collected from such surcharges for research and development programs designed to enhance U.S. competitiveness.
